{"step_by_step_thinking": "Anchorage in orthodontics refers to the way of controlling unwanted tooth movement by using a stable area in the mouth. Reciprocal anchorage refers to the mutual support that two teeth or groups of teeth exert on each other. Stationary anchorage refers to the use of an immovable or stable object or area in the mouth to prevent unwanted tooth movement. Intramaxillary anchorage refers to the use of teeth within the same jaw for anchorage. Intraoral anchorage refers to the use of other teeth or areas within the mouth for anchorage. The question is asking about a situation where anchorage is not being applied, so none of these options would be correct.", "answer_choice": "None of the above"}
